title: Ratdb
text: default, Rat.db uses disk-based caching system store API responses. prevents redundant queries SIPRI database, improving performance reducing server load. However, keep mind prevent getting recent data, SIPRI data renewed, still using cached data. caching default disabled.

title: Ratdb
text: Maximum Cache Size: 1GB (1024 * 1024^2 bytes) Maximum Cache Age: 1 year (606024*365 seconds) Maximum Cached Entries: Unlimited (Inf)

title: Ratdb
text: Users can override default cache settings setting environment variables loading package:
code: Sys.setenv(RATDB_CACHE_MAX_SIZE = "500 * 1024^2")  # Set max cache size to 500MB Sys.setenv(RATDB_CACHE_MAX_AGE = "60*60*24*180")  # Set max cache age to 180 days Sys.setenv(RATDB_CACHE_MAX_N = "500")             # Limit cache to 500 entries

title: Ratdb
text: needed, users can manually prune cache running: remove expired entries, ensuring outdated data used queries. However, also happens automatically every request cache = TRUE. can also run destroy() fully delete cache. Note however, requires session restart work package afterwards.
code: cachem::cache_disk(dir = tools::R_user_dir('Rat.db', which = 'cache'))$prune() cachem::cache_disk(dir = tools::R_user_dir('Rat.db', which = 'cache'))$destroy()
